Australia: The High Court of Australia is established with Samuel Griffith as the first Chief Justice. The Defence Act gives the federal government full control over the Australian Army 1903 Australian federal election: Alfred Deakin is elected as the 2nd Prime Minister of Australia.
Bhutan:
The last reigning Shabdrung dies, and a successor is not found until 1906. In the meantime, the civil administration comes under the power of the Ugyen Wangchuck as Desi.
Ugyen Wangchuck volunteers to accompany a British mission to Lhasa as a mediator in the British expedition to Tibet and resulting Anglo-Tibetan Convention. In return, Ugyen is knighted and thereafter continues to accrue greater power in Bhutan. (to 1904)
Brazil: The Treaty of Petrópolis ends tension between Brazil and Bolivia over the then-Bolivian territory of Acre (today the Acre state).
Burundi: Burundi came under the control of Germany.
Chile: The first auction of sheep farming lands in the Magallanes Territory takes place.
Colombia: Panama remained as a province of Colombia until this year, when – with backing from the United States in exchange for allowing the US to build the Panama Canal – it became independent (Separation of Panama from Colombia) The United States and the Republic of Colombia sign the Hay–Herrán Treaty The United States Navy patrol gunboat USS Nashville blocks Colombian attempts to suppress the Panamanian separatist movement
India:
British Expedition to Tibet
Delhi Durbar Second Time.
Philippine: Governor Taft enunciates the policy of The Philippines for the Filipinos
Thousands of members of the Union Obrera Democratica Filipina, led by Dominador Gomez, stage a massive rally aiming for workers’ rights as well as a public holiday for May 1.
Establishment of the Moro Province, consisting of the districts of Jolo, Lanao, Cotabato, Davao and Zamboanga.
Russia: Russification of Finland: The office of the Governor-General was given dictatorial powers. Kishinev pogrom: A three-day pogrom began, which would leave forty-seven Jews dead. At the second congress of the RSDLP, the party split into two factions: the Bolsheviks, led by Vladimir Lenin, and the less radical Mensheviks.
Serbia: The May Coup d'Etat results in the assassination of the royal couple King Aleksandar Obrenović and Queen Draga Mašin by Black Hand activists.
